The claim was found to be outdated in re: as it was originally made in 2015.
Various reputable sources such as Oregon: Earth and Sky, and NASA had published articles about the rare Christmas full moon in 2015, supporting the claim at that time.
An excerpt from a NASA blog post dated 1: 4. However, according to Space.com, the full moon of December 2018 actually occurred on the 22nd day of that month, not on Christmas Day, contradicting the claim. The next occurrence of a full moon coinciding with Christmas won't happen until 2034.
